security Education Gift cards Licensing Unlocked stories View Sitemap Search Search or ask a question No results Cancel Frequently Asked Questions Microsoft stock | Microsoft Corporate | Dividends for shareholders | Microsoft stock splits | Financials and SEC filings | Microsoft debt | Contact info for shareholders Microsoft Stock Expand All | Collapse All Q. Does Microsoft pay a dividend? A. Microsoft pays a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share. Read the Dividend FAQ for more information. Back to Top Q. What exchange does Microsoft stock trade on? A. Microsoft common shares are traded on The Nasdaq Stock Market. The ticker symbol is MSFT. Back to Top Q. How can I get the current Microsoft stock price? A. MSN® Money can provide a 15 minute delayed price, as well as other information regarding Microsoft stock. Back to Top Q. What was the offering price at Microsoft&#39;s initial public offering (IPO)? A. The offering price was $21.00 per share at the IPO on March 13, 1986. Back to Top Q. Who should I contact regarding my stock certificate(s)? A. You should contact Microsoft&#39;s transfer agent, Computershare, by one of these methods: • Internet: https://www.computershare.com/Microsoft • E-mail: web.queries&#64;computershare.com • Phone: (800) 285-7772 Option 1 (425) 706-4400 Option 1 (International) For Written Shareholder Inquiries By Mail: Computershare P.O. Box 43006 Providence RI 02940-3078 By Overnight/Certified/Registered Delivery Computershare 150 Royall St., Suite 101 Canton, MA 02021 United States of America Back to Top Q. What is Microsoft&#39;s CUSIP number? A. 594918104 Back to Top Q. When is the next annual shareholders meeting? A. The 2025 Annual Shareholders Meeting will be held virtually on December 5, 2025. The meeting will start at 8:30 am PT. Back to Top Q. When was the last annual shareholders meeting? A. The 2024 annual shareholders meeting was held on December 10, 2024, The meeting can be viewed here. here . Back to Top Q. Do you issue preferred stock? A. Microsoft no longer offers preferred shares. Back to Top Related Information View latest Earnings Release SEC Filings XBRL Board &amp; ESG Voting Results Board Initiates Review of Policy Microsoft Corporate Expand All | Collapse All Q. Where can I get information on the company? A. This corporate information page contains a variety of links regarding Microsoft. Back to Top Q. Where can I get information about Microsoft&#39;s Board of Directors? A. This link will take you to Microsoft&#39;s Board of Directors . Click on each member&#39;s name to read their full biography. Back to Top Q. Who is Microsoft&#39;s independent auditor? A. Microsoft&#39;s independent auditor is Deloitte &amp; Touche. Back to Top Q. Where can I get company historical information? A. The Important Dates section provides a good overview of Microsoft’s history. Back to Top Q. What are Microsoft&#39;s values and mission? A. Microsoft&#39;s mission, as well as how we intend to deliver on our mission, are outlined on Mission and Values page . Back to Top Q. Where can I get employment information? A. Lots of information is available at the jobs site . Back to Top Q. What year and where was Microsoft incorporated? A. Microsoft was incorporated in the state of Washington on June 25, 1981; reincorporated in the state of Delaware on September 19, 1986; and reincorporated in the state of Washington on September 22, 1993. Back to Top Q. What is Microsoft&#39;s full-time worldwide headcount? A. Microsoft&#39;s past and current headcounts can be found on our Fast Facts About Microsoft page. Back to Top Q. What companies has Microsoft invested in or acquired? A. View our investments and acquisitions . Back to Top Q. Is it possible for a shareholder to tour the Microsoft campus? A. The general public is allowed to visit the Microsoft Visitor Center. Click here for hours and locations . Back to Top Q. I&#39;m a shareholder and I need product support. Who do I contact? A. Visit our online Product Support Services . You can choose from a variety of options. Back to Top Dividends for shareholders Expand All | Collapse All Q. Does Microsoft have a direct stock purchase plan or a dividend reinvestment plan? A. Computershare, Microsoft&#39;s transfer agent, administers a direct stock purchase plan and a dividend reinvestment plan for the company. To find out more about these programs you may contact Computershare directly at (800) 285-7772, Option 1, between the hours of 8 A.M. and 8 P.M. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday, and Saturday 9 A.M and 5 P.M. Eastern Time. Alternatively, you can the view program online by going to Computershare&#39;s website. Back to Top Q. Does Microsoft pay a quarterly dividend? A. Microsoft pays a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share. Read the press release . Back to Top Q. What is Microsoft&#39;s dividend history? A. This table lists the dividend payments, amounts, and key dates: Quarterly Dividend Annual Dividend Dividend Period Amount Announcement Date Ex-Dividend Date Record Date Payable Date 2003 $0.08 Jan 16, 2003 Feb 19, 2003 Feb 21, 2003 Mar 7, 2003 2004 $0.16 Sep 12, 2003 Oct 15, 2003 Oct 17, 2003 Nov 7, 2003 Special Dividend Dividend Period Amount Announcement Date Ex-Dividend Date Record Date Payable Date Special $3.00 Jul 20, 2004 Nov 15, 2004 Nov 17, 2004 Dec 2, 2004 Back to Top Microsoft stock splits Expand All | Collapse All Q. Will there be a stock split? A. The Board of Directors makes the decision for any stock split. The most current split was a 2-for-1 common stock split announced on January 16, 2003. The stock will commence trading at the new split price February 18, 2003. This was our ninth stock split since going public March 13, 1986. Read the press release: Microsoft Declares Annual Dividend and Announces Two-for-One Split on Common Stock. Back to Top Q. When has Microsoft common stock split? A. The most recent split was a 2-for-1 common stock split announced on January 16, 2003. The stock traded at the new split price on February 18, 2003. This was Microsoft&#39;s ninth stock split going public March 13, 1986. For more information, read the press release: Microsoft Declares Annual Dividend and Announces Two-for-One Split on Common Stock. After this most recent split, one original share equals 288 shares. This chart summarizes Microsoft&#39;s nine common stock splits since the initial public offering on March 13, 1986: Payable Date Type of Split* Closing Price Before Closing Price After September 18, 1987 2 for 1 $114.50 (Sep 18) $53.50 (Sep 21) April 12, 1990 2 for 1 $120.75 (Apr 12) $60.75 (Apr 16) June 26, 1991 3 for 2 $100.75 (Jun 26) $68.00 (Jun 27) June 12, 1992 3 for 2 $112.50 (Jun 12) $75.75 (Jun 15) May 20, 1994 2 for 1 $97.75 (May 20) $50.63 (May 23) December 6, 1996 2 for 1 $152.875 (Dec 6) $81.75 (Dec 9) February 20, 1998 2 for 1 $155.13 (Feb 20) $81.63 (Feb 23) March 26, 1999 2 for 1 $178.13 (Mar 26) $92.38 (Mar 29) February 14, 2003 2 for 1 $48.30 (Feb 14) $24.96 (Feb 18) *Type of split: 2 for 1 &#61; One additional share for every share held (multiply the number of shares by 2 for a new total) 3 for 2 &#61; One additional share for every two shares held (multiply the number of shares by 1.5 for a new total) Back to Top Q. How does a 2-for-1 stock split actually work? A. A 2-for-1 split means the investor will have twice as many shares as he had before, at half the market price. Here&#39;s an example: As of the record date (January 27, 2003) if an investor owns 100 shares of MSFT and the market price is $50.00/share, that investor&#39;s total value is $5,000.00. After the split, the investor will have 200 shares of stock, but the market price will be approximately $25.00/share. The investor&#39;s total investment value in MSFT remains the same at $5,000.00 until the stock price moves up or down. Back to Top Q. Why did you split the stock now? A. The decision to split the stock was made by Microsoft&#39;s Board of Directors, based on a desire to make our stock more accessible to a broader range of investors. Back to Top Q. How many times have you split the stock? A. This is the ninth time the company has split the stock since Microsoft went public back in March 1986. One original share will equal 288 shares after this split is effective. Back to Top Financials and SEC filings Expand All | Collapse All Q. When is the next earnings release? A. The next earnings release will be announced soon. A webcast of the conference call will be available from the Microsoft Investor Relations page. Back to Top Q. What is Microsoft&#39;s fiscal year and corresponding earnings release dates? A. Microsoft&#39;s fiscal year runs from July 1 to June 30. Q1 October 29, 2025 Press Release Q2 January 28, 2026 Press Release Q3 TBA Earnings will be released after the stock market closes. There will also be a webcast of the call with financial analysts. Q4 TBA Earnings will be released after the stock market closes. There will also be a webcast of the call with financial analysts. Back to Top Q. Does Microsoft issue quarterly reports? A. No, because of increased printing and distribution costs, as well as the commitment to the use of our own technologies, Microsoft no longer issues printed quarterly reports but focuses on electronic media instead. You can look at all earnings releases on this website. Back to Top Q. How do I get a copy of the Annual Report? A. Here is our 2025 Microsoft Annual Report online. You can also download a Microsoft Word version of the 2025 Annual Report. Back to Top Microsoft debt Expand All | Collapse All Q.What is the credit rating of Microsoft? A. The Microsoft corporate credit rating is AAA and Aaa by Standard &amp; Poor&#39;s Rating Services and Moody&#39;s Investors Service Inc., respectively. The commercial paper is rated A-1&#43; by Standard &amp; Poor&#39;s and P-1 by Moody&#39;s. Back to Top Q.How can I buy Microsoft bonds? A. To purchase Microsoft bonds, please consult your financial advisor or broker.
